result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus James Kilgore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marcus James Kilgore in court.  Attorney Allison A Markoski in court for Marcus James Kilgore.  Court states cases and appearances.  Atty Markoski makes record that the DE doesn't qualify for a PD appt in 22CF315.  DE agrees and states he will represent himself in that matter.  Court questions him and accepts that waiver.  Atty Markoski states there is a joint recommendation resolving both matters.  State agrees to rec. as stated by Atty Markoski.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver in 22CF315.  DE agrees to waive that.  Court accepts waiver of prelim/finds probable cause/binds DE over.  Court questions DE on the plea agreement as to all four counts.  DE pleads NC.  Court accepts pleas/finds DE guilty.  State notes Ch 950 has been complied with and makes statement on behalf of the joint recommendations.  Atty Markoski makes statement on behalf of DE.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court reminds DE re: voting rights and felony firearms warnings.

20CM190
Ct 1:  NC
Ct 3:  NC
Ct 7:  NC

22CF315 
Ct 1:  NC

All remaining counts are dismissed/read-in

On each case/count - Two (2) years probation concurrent to each other
Costs/surcharges of $543.00, $443.00, $443.00 and $518.00 - to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA samples to be provided
Conditions of probation:
Domestic abuse assessment and follow through w/any recommended treatment
No contact with A.L.A.
22CF315 has one (1) day credit if revoked
Waiver of Prelim on June 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:50 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess and intern Dan Moon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marcus James Kilgore appeared by video, in custody from LEC w/atty. Dolch. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties. DE does not qualify for PD representation.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  State requests $300 Cash bond. Atty. Dolch has conflict with this case, represented KMS prior.  DE has no objection for this hearing.   Atty. Dolch requests signature bond and objections to the Absolute Sobriety condition. No allegations.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $1500.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact with K.M.S.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return date scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
